info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 2:43PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL FRANKLIN, NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON, BUTLER AND SOUTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 243 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Harrison, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, penny size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Forest Park, Sharonville, Monroe, Trenton, Springdale, Harrison, South Middletown, West Chester, Ross, Seven Mile, Taylor Creek, Williamsdale, Olde West Chester, Four Bridges, Dunlap and Wetherington. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio near mile marker 23. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 3. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 18 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...and southwestern and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
